meaningMnemonic: There are <radical>sheep</radical> right before your <radical>eye</radical>s, because they just love what you <kanji>wear</kanji>. It's a little known fact that sheep are fashionistas, and they <kanji>arrive</kanji> daily to admire your style. These sheep are so stylish they wear their tail to one side - in the latest fashion (check out the sheep radical - the tail is sweeping stylishly to the left!).
readingMnemonic: More sheep <kanji>arrive</kanji> every day to admire the clothes you're <kanji>wear</kanji>ing. You use a <reading>chalk</reading> (ちゃく) board to keep count of how many sheep come by each day.
